intro: Erigeron praecox, commonly known as common fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open areas such as meadows, roadsides, and disturbed soils, and it thrives in full sun. Its flowering period occurs in the summer months, producing fluffy white or pale yellow blooms. Erigeron praecox is often used in wildflower gardens due to its ornamental value and ability to support pollinators.
